channel.title: Posts on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on A Hugo website

item.title: Are college teams passing more on first down?
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(cfbfastR) library(ggalt) In this blog post, I will be analyzing how first down pass rates have changed over recent years. Later, I will compare the entirety of college football with simply the Big Ten conference to see how they fair against the masses. First I called in the data. tictoc::tic() pbp <- data.frame() seasons <- 2014:cfbfastR:::most_recent_cfb_season() progressr::with_progress({ pbp <- cfbfastR::load_cfb_pbp(seasons) }) Next, I made filters for all first plays in general as well as only passing plays.

item.title: NFL Redzone EPA Reverse Enigneering
item.description: In this post, the goal is reverse engineer a story regarding Redzone EPA through the first three weeks of the NFL story. In this case, we created a dumbbell chart that depicts how teams faired in the Redzone through the first three weeks compared to the season as a whole. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.5 ## ✔ tibble 3.

item.title: Volleyball Aces
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.5 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.10 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.1 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.3 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggbeeswarm) library(ggrepel) set.seed(1234) Volleyball <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dwillis/NCAAWomensVolleyballData/main/data/ncaa_womens_volleyball_playerstats_2022.csv") ## Rows: 5379 Columns: 32 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (7): team, full_name, roster_name, last_name, first_name, yr, pos ## dbl (23): season, jersey, feet, inches, gp, gs, mp, s, kills, errors, total_.

item.title: Maryland Football Yards Per Play
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.5 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.10 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.1 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.3 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggrepel) logs <- read_csv("https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/footballlogs1122.csv") ## Rows: 18050 Columns: 57 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (9): HomeAway, Opponent, Result, TeamFull, TeamURL, Outcome, Team, Con.

item.title: CFB Recruiting Ratings and Wins
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.5 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.10 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.1 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.3 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() recordsbyyear <- read_csv ("https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/all_teams.csv") ## Rows: 904 Columns: 21 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (3): team, conference, division ## dbl (18): year, expected_wins, total_games, total_wins, total_losses, total_.

item.title: First Pass Interceptions
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.5 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.10 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.1 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.3 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(cfbfastR) tictoc::tic() pbp <- data.frame() seasons <- 2014:cfbfastR:::most_recent_cfb_season() progressr::with_progress({ pbp <- cfbfastR::load_cfb_pbp(seasons) }) first_plays_game <- pbp %>% filter(firstD_by_poss == 1, lag_kickoff_play == 1, drive_number == 1, play_type !

item.title: Points by Maryland Volleyball
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.7 ## ✔ tidyr 1.1.4 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.1 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(waffle) VB <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dwillis/NCAAWomensVolleyballData/main/data/ncaa_womens_volleyball_matchstats_2022.csv") ## Rows: 6077 Columns: 36 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (3): team, opponent, home_away ## dbl (31): team_score, opponent_score, s, kills, errors, total_attacks, hit_.

item.title: Big Ten Average Plays
item.description: Big Ten Average Plays Analysis library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.7 ## ✔ tidyr 1.1.4 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.1 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(scales) ## ## Attaching package: 'scales' ## The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': ## ## discard ## The following object is masked from 'package:readr': ## ## col_factor B10 <- read_csv ("https://dwillis.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
